pr_title: Damage decals showing the unit damage level on icons

timeline.message: Damage decals show unit damage level on the icons
More decals, separated by weight, no infantry smoke, cleanup
No decals for lobby, multihex units only on center
multihex units get scarred on all hexes, smoke on the center
Reduced smoke for narrow unit types

timeline.bodyText: Is there a way of determining this based on the unit image (without any too crazy computations)? e.g. checking width/height?  A Demolisher tank might warrant three smoke stacks, while a Maultier APC only really needs one.
timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText: Possible by checking the pixels in the center row. I just think that it wouldn't make a big difference; two or three smoke stacks on a unit that could hold three but burns alright with two - in other words, all the pixel-counting effort wouldn't really show in the result. I wouldnt really want to do that to increase the number of smoke stacks. If on the other hand many units showed smoke stacks where there shouldnt be any and a weight test doesnt help, then that's a good solution.
replies.author: SJuliez

replies.bodyText: I'm not aware of too many skinny 100-ton tanks. I guess the Long Tom + Trailer currently? Probably let's leave it for a later PR.
replies.author: NickAragua

timeline.bodyText: Did you just move this file, or did you make changes to it? If the latter, could you point to where the changes are?
timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText:
I'm really a git noob. Does it show everything as changed because I moved it?
Well in reality, I changed almost everything because there was so much redundant and (to me) unorganized code. I also moved out EntityImage to its own class and removed the default hex Tileset that was in there as a 1000-line long list of println (instead that default is now present as a simple text file in case something with the actual tileset files goes wrong... and I guess there's a few other files that can crash MM when they're not present so why worry too much about this one).
